title: Artaxerxes III
summary: Ochus (Ancient Greek: Ὦχος, Ôkhos; Babylonian: Ú-ma-kuš), better known by his dynastic name of Artaxerxes III (Old Persian: 𐎠𐎼𐎫𐎧𐏁𐏂𐎠, romanized: Artaxšaçāʰ; Ancient Greek: Ἀρταξέρξης Artaxérxēs) was King of Kings of the Achaemenid Empire from 358 to 338 BC. He was the son and successor of Artaxerxes II (r. 404 – 358 BC) and his mother was Stateira.
